elements.text: I always had a lot of success with Facebook group networking

text:
I found the toughest part of moving into a strategy/more senior role is getting (and staying) out of the weeds (little to no writing/editing) and communicating (and re-communicating) your vision to leadership and peers over and over again.
Make sure you’re spending time building your plan; communicating it to leaders, peers and employees; doing thinking/planning on resources you need; and setting up foundational elements that will help you/your team scale (tone and voice guide, brief model, metrics tracking, etc.).
If you’re doing all of that, you’re probably doing a good (strategic) job!

elements.text:

Make sure you’re spending time building your plan; communicating it to leaders, peers and employees; doing thinking/planning on resources you need; and setting up foundational elements that will help you/your team scale (tone and voice guide, brief model, metrics tracking, etc.).
If you’re doing all of that, you’re probably doing a good (strategic) job!

text: One of my dearest friends runs a content company out of India. She is probably the best product launch professional I have ever met, and when I first came to know her, I had NO idea she wasn't a native English speaker or that she was based out of India. One thing that helped her stand out (besides her work quality, which speaks for itself) is that she did her best to participate in U.S. events, conferences, masterminds, etc. She just became part of so many core groups, no one questioned where she worked from -- it didn't matter. Now, she had to invest quite a bit to come to the U.S. for such things, but now, with the travel situation bleaker than ever, this won't be possible for most. The upside is that most really great events are virtual, so no travel barriers. Can you join up with some groups or offer to speak at some events so that you can showcase your ability to work with all kinds of people? That and referrals are how my friend took her business to half a million in five years. She's honestly a superstar in her niche, and her location/residency has never come into question for most clients.
